headline: Broccoli-Cauliflower Salad
description: Crunchy broccoli and cauliflower florets are tossed with salty bacon, hard-boiled eggs, cheddar cheese, and a mayo dressing.

video.description: See how easy it is to make this hearty, salad-bar-style salad.
video.name: Broccoli-Cauliflower Salad

name: Broccoli-Cauliflower Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Crumble and set aside.
In a medium sized salad bowl, layer in order the broccoli, cauliflower, eggs, cheese and bacon.
Prepare the dressing by whisking together the mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar. Drizzle dressing over top and serve.

review.reviewBody: I didn't add bacon or eggs and it turned out great! I'd make sure that you stuff that cup with veggies or you're going to have extra dressing

Delicious. The whole family gave it 5 stars. Made this salad without bacon to make it vegetarian. Followed advice of some reviewers and only added half of the dressing but it was not enough for our taste so I added more. In total I’d say I put 3/4 of the dressing which more than enough. I also added some red onion and sunflower seeds per recommendations. Even more delicious. I couldn’t help myself and added pumpkin seeds too.

This is delicious!! I’ve made it a few times. Cut the dressing in half though or you will have about 2 cups left!! Way too much. I also don’t add all the sugar because it’s too sweet. I add about 1/3 of the sugar. I add sunflower seeds to it also.
I made this last night but I added green onions and tomato and only made about half of the dressing. It was delicious and this morning, after being in the fridge overnight, it was wonderful!

I didn’t have wine vinegar so I used an old opened Bottle of white wine and it did just fine. I’ve been making this salad since it was discovered while vacationing in NC, when I was looking for something to make with the ingredients I had on hand. My husband and I loved it so much that it has become a staple in our home. What a great find!
Not what I was expecting needed so!etching else.
I did it! I added peas and mushrooms, also I did the dressing with Mayo-chipotle for an extra spicy. So ñumi!

I have made this twice now and it's delicious. I don't eat eggs so I left those out and I was out of onions. After making it the first time, I felt like it was missing something... my husband suggested diced dill pickles and that did the trick! A great way to use up extra veggies and it gets better each time. I did wait until serving to add the salted sunflower seeds, they topped it off perfectly.

Best Broccoli Salad Ever!! The dressing is to die for! Firstly, I was so happy to find a Broccoli Salad recipe that doesn't have onions in it because I am not a fan. I always double the broccoli and cauliflower which makes the amount of dressing perfect. Do not skip the eggs if you can help it. Definitely add sunflower seeds as other reviewers suggest, it adds a great crunch. And lastly, make sure you wait to add the dressing, topped with bacon and sunflower seeds, right before serving. SO GOOD!
This was absolutely delicious. I cut the dressing in half and it was the perfect amount. Two of us ate it all with grilled steaks.
Love this recipe! It’s a favorite of my family. I add some sunflower seeds on top ! Soooo good!

Similar to broccoli salad, I’ve never made it with cauliflower and eggs turned out good but prefer the style without the eggs and with grapes, craisins, and red onion. Oh! And instead of white vinegar I used red wine vinegar for a little more flavor.
We both enjoyed it and will be making it again
Delicious! I added less sugar.
This is a wonderful salad, I have used this dressing with spinichh salads for years as well- it's a great combo!!
I didn’t need all the dressing will definitely serve it on the side next time
I made 1/2 the dressing to poor over! Yum!!
I love this I put 2 cups of veggie, was easier to make then I thought. Brought 1 thing of cauliflower and broccoli and had enough to make two bowl one for home and one for pot luck
perfect salad as is

This was delicious! I made this as a one-bowl lunch for myself and just mixed everything together. I can see the layering, as the instructions state, if you're looking for a nice presentation to serve to a crowd. I scaled this down to 4 servings (1/2 cup each of the veggies). I cut the dressing back again, because I couldn't see using 1/2 cup mayo just for a bowl for myself. The dressing worked very well with all of the ingredients. I also just used one hard-boiled egg. Topped with salt and pepper for a delicious and healthy lunch! Nice recipe!
Yummy! If I was single I would eat this every night for dinner
There's way too much sugar in the dressing. I'll cut it in half, at least, the next time.

I've made this twice. the first time I stuck to the recipe. the second time, I blanched the veggies for 1 minute then cooled. I reduced the sugar by 1/2 , used rice wine vinegar, and added diced red onion. The kids loved it but said, "less sugar next time! " Third time's a charm!

I followed the recipe, but couldn't find white wine vinegar, so to reduce acidity and strength, used 1 tablespoon of water and 1 tablespoon of white vinegar. Everyone liked the salad and asked for the recipe. I did stir just prior to serving. I thought the amount of dressing could be reduced a little, but everyone else thought it was great as it was made.
Great salad! The bacon makes it complete so don't forget the bacon!
This was okay for me...
We love this recipe, the only thing I changed is I use 1/4 cup of mayo and 3 tbsp of vinegar

We love this recipe with a few changes to our taste. I use an entire head of broccoli and cauliflower and maybe a bit less mayo adding shelled sunflower seeds and dried cranberries. Sometimes I add shredded cheddar but I love it without so why add the calories.

Wow this recipe is awesome. The only thing I did differently was add craisens in a layer. My husband who's a meat and potatoes kinda guy raved about a vegetable recipe. So that says something. Thanks for a very simple, delicious recipe!

I love this recipe. I used half a head of purple cauliflower along with white and broccoli and it make the presentation that much better. I served it to my family and friends and both couldn't believe how good it was and asked for the recipe. It is a perfect way to use the cauliflower that is in my fridge.
This is delicious I made it exactly the way it says.But I did not put so much mayonnaise just half. Also I used more vinegar so delicious a keeper. Everybody liked it o I also used less sugar
Yuck! We did not like it at all.
This has been one of my favorite recipes for years. The only thing I do different is adding a cup or so of (still frozen) peas. My kids prefer it without the eggs, but either way it's great!
Great taste, good looks.

I make this salad often, with less sugar and used Splenda. I also use hormel real bacon bits, the whole small bag. This really cuts back on calories and carbs. Red onions work well. I will be trying the curry and raisins. Toss night before serving, toss again before serving.

I've tried this, only I added green onions, sometimes grapes and other times raisins and cashews. I make the dressing a little different, but it's delicious either way. I use one cup of mayo, a half can of sweetened condensed milk, 1/4 c sugar and 1/8 of a cup of vinegar. This dressing recipe is actually cut in half, so you could double it.

One of the things I love about this site is the reviews by home cooks. I took their advice and cut the amount of dressing by half and lessened the sweetness considerably, using a stevia-erythritol substitute. So glad I did. I decided not to measure the eggs, just adding two to the overall mix. I also subbed white vinegar for the white wine vinegar. Such an easy, delicious salad.
I did use only half the dressing and it was great. Would like to add red bell pepper, red onion, and sunflower seeds next time.

My mother used to make this when I was a kid and we loved it. I could not remember the recipe, so I found this, it is pretty close. Although after making this version, it is too sweet and has too much dressing. I did 1 1/2 cups of each broccoli and cauliflower 1 cup fat free mayo, 2 tbls water, 2 hard boiled eggs 1/2 cup shredded cheese, 1/4 cup sugar, 6 slices chopped bacon, and to add a little kick I also finely chop 1/4 cup red onion. I just mix everything together. 
The red onion just adds something special! My 7 yr old twins HATE onion but LOVED this, in fact it turns out they wanted seconds and begged me to make it again!
Unfortunately, I didn't have bacon, so I went out on a limb and subbed pepperoni. Still very delicious. (Used only 2 tbs of sugar.)

This was very good. I did decrease the sugar by a lot, a 1/2 cup seemed like too much for 1 cup of mayo. I only used 2 T of sugar and it was more than enough. I also used about 3 cups each of the broccoli/cauliflower. I also kept the dressing on the side and drizzled it over each salad before serving. I also added sunflower seeds (as others stated in their reviews) and it was so good. I will make this again for sure.
I cooked this over the Christmas holiday and it was gone in a flash. The husband, in-laws, and all the kids loved it! Definitely a keeper!
Loved this!! Hubby wanted onions, so did add diced red onions. But it would be wonderful without them also.

I had something like this but not with large pieces and layered. I chopped the broccoli and cauliflower into pieces the size of a pea. I added finely shredded carrot (1 medium), white raisins and sunflower seeds. I skipped the bacon and egg to make if vegetarian. It made about 2 quarts. It is also better the second day after the mixture has marinated. 
This also adds crunch and makes a great replacement for coleslaw on sandwiches with ham or turkey.

Sorry to say but this recipe didn't cut it with me despite all the rave reviews. I was surprised to find that the recipe didn't require the broccoli or cauliflower to be cooked at least a little bit, I mean seriously who eats these vegetables raw? Anyway I ended up steaming in some water for a few minutes until they were slightly cooked though still retaining the crunch thus making it edible. Now for the sauce... it was bad sorry! After reading the reviews, we halved the amount and used low fat Mayo BUT it was still SO SUPER SWEET and ended up STILL BEING WAY TO MUCH!!! I ended up adding some wholegrain honey mustard and it was much better. We let each person help themselves to the sauce and at the end there is still heaps left over. The taste of this combination overall was a bit strange as well - my tastebuds were looking for potatoes as this would've been good with some potatos yet there weren't any... Sorry but won't be making this one again.
This is super YUMMY!! My kids also give it 2 thumbs up. Its quick and easy and it taste even better the next day.
Mmmm - crunchy and full of flavour.

YUM! The taste deserves 5 stars, but I think the need for tweaking requires a star drop. I followed reviewer advice and cut mayo and sugar in half (though kept vinegar as written), which made it perfect. I also omitted eggs and added raisins and green onions. We gobbled it up!!
I use ranch dressing in place of the sugar and vinegar mixture. My family loves this and I do too.
Yummy! I made this salad for our Family Get- Together. Everyone loved it! Did not make any changes.

I know I used more broccoli and cauliflower than the recipe called for, but it was definitely delicious.
Edited to add: I didn't have any bacon tonight, but it was still pretty good.

I made half the dressing and also reduced the sugar to 3 tablespoons. It came out very tasty. The next time I made it I jazzed it up a bit with 1/4 chopped red onion, 1/3 cup craisins, 1/3 cup pumpkin seeds. It came out excellent!

Let me start by saying I HATE cauliflower but made this because my husband bought some and I didn't want it to go bad in the fridge. This was honestly the best recipe using cauliflower I have ever eaten! I will definitely make (and eat) this again and again!
We love this salad. I've made it twice now, the second time adding two sliced green onions. Only half the dressing is needed, I'll cut that in half next time.

Thanks, Colleen, for this great recipe. I also made a few tweeks: I used less egg, subbed Splenda for the sugar, added some diced red pepper for color and some chopped red onion. And, I mixed it all together. We loved it, and I'm sure I will make it again and again.
DELICIOUS!

used 2 cups broccoli
2 cups cauliflower
1 Cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese
12 slices of bacon
about 1/2 of a red onion
1 cup mayo
1/2 cup white sugar
2 Tablespoons white wine vinegar
sprinkled sunflower seeds
perfect!
very tasty salad, easy to modify. I add slivers of purple onion and shredded carrot.

I love this salad in all of its myriad forms. I have NEVER used any sweetener in the dressing: only mayonnaise and sometimes a little balsamic vinegar. AND the veggies can be cooked slightly (very slightly parboiled) for those who cannot digest raw food well--be sure they are still crunchy. I like adding boiled eggs and the bacon is essential. You can also add chopped onion, celery, bell pepper for extra crunch/flavor. Season with salt and pepper to taste and add some cayenne if you like it spicy. Everyone loves it, even those who say they don't like broccoli or cauliflower.

Wanted something different than the same old steamed broccoli and cauliflower. This salad was excellent. We had it Christmas dinner and we all enjoyed it. I made it a little healthier by using light mayo and splenda. A delicious alternative to the traditional holiday fare.

Excellent salad. used 4 cups each of broccoli & cauliflower, 1 pd crumbled bacon, 1/4 cup sugar to 1 1/2 cups mayonaise, green onions as suggested by a previous reviewer was nice. Very easy to make and very good.
LOVED this! I'm asked to bring it to every picnic we attend. Great recipe!

I want to give this recipe a 5 star but I can't. I made this for a dinner party and it didn't go over very well. It was avoided like the plague. And the only person I saw that ate this and like it was my middle child. So tried it and realized...man it was too sweet tasting but was a sweet mayo flavor. Was not good. So the only thing I could think of that would numb the sweetness without over salting or over peppering was celery salt. It seemed to do the trick after a few shakes here and there and tasting and re-shakng some more. until it was mellowed. I'd say the veggies and bacon were fresh and light. But the dressing really didn't do them justice. Sorry. My advice, cut the sugar down or add more vinegar.
Thanks Colleen. It was good. I didn't use all the dressing but really it's not your fault there was "too much", it's purely preferance. So don't blame her! I hope everyone enjoys it.

A version of this salad has floated around my family for a while. Usually we omit the eggs and cheese and add black olives, raisins and carrots. Sometimes sunflower seeds too. It's definitely a crowd pleaser!

Only thing I do different is add sunflower seeds.This is a terrific recipe!!! I cant tell you how many of my friends now make this recipe too because I always, always get asked for it!! Thanks for sharing!

yum! used light mayo, and 1 pkg of truvia in place of the sugar. i didn't use bacon, but instead added about 1/2 tsp of liquid smoke. like other i just mixed it all together. i will def make this again! thanks for the post Colleen!

I love this recipe. I've made it several times, sometimes as stated and sometimes with variations. One of my favorites is to use mostly cauliflower and only add the broccoli for green accent. I like to add onions as well, and today for a picnic I added one sweet red pepper, chopped fairly fine. I do cut back on the sugar using balsamic vinegar with it's sweetness, and use light mayo. Different cheese add a nice twist at times, as can finely chopped ham instead of the bacon. This is what I consider a great foundational recipe, with endless variations!

Tasty and quick. I chopped up the veggies and did not layer them. Having used up all my mayonnaise on a chicken salad, I used a bottle of Caesar dressing. It was wonderful! Hubby doesn't like to taste any kind of tartness, so I just put a healthy sprinkle of red wine vinegar and a little tiny bit more sugar so he wouldn't be unhappy. He wasn't. This is one of those recipes I will be using again at family get togethers. I had tripled it except for the vinegar.
really good. next time I will not add the egg.

Excellent! My family does not like eating raw broccoli or raw cauliflower, but they absolutley loved this salad. I made this as a side for BBQ Jamaican jerk chicken, and there was nothing left over. Will defenetley make again.
This salad is fantastic bbq food. Even my mostly vegan niece ate it...and asked for the recipe!
I omitted the eggs and cut the dressing by 1/2.
This salad is awesome. I just used broccoli but it turned out great. I used pre-cooked crumbled bacon .

Whole head of cauliflower, 3 small bunches of broccoli, double the dressing, and a lb of good quality thick bacon. Peppered bacon is nice. Use your kitchen shears to cut the bacon. I have never added or seen anyone add eggs to their salad. I do not like a lot of cheese so I barely add 1 cup to the whole thing. I always add 1/2 a med diced red onion. It's a must.
Made this for a Christmas gathering. Everyone seemed to like it.

The day after Thanksgiven and I have a veggie tray left. Fpund this made as stated except used Ranch Dressing. Was soo good. Later I added chopped turkey, red oinion and red pepper served on a bed of lettuce. Was great both ways. Thanks for a recipe I can take to potlucks or use for leftovers!
This is best using the dressing recipe from the "Bodacious Broccoli Salad" recipe. And it's just as good with pre-cooked bacon.

This was superb. I made this yesterday for a small shindig and I was glad that I had enough left for a small container of leftovers for me. I bought one of those mixed broccoli/cauliflower bags and just used that. I omitted the eggs (not by choice, I ran out of time to make a few), and after reading a few reviews, I too cut the mayo/sugar/vinegar in half, and it was MORE than sufficient. This flavor is exactly like what you can get in the grocery stores. Next time I make this, and I will make it again soon, I'm going to add the egg, some peas, and shredded carrot. This is how I use to get it at a grocery store in WI and it was just divine. I'm also going to up the bacon. LOVE this recipe.
Definitely only need to make half of the dressing per recipe. It's more than plenty. Kids loved it.
Without actually trying this recipe I will rate it only because I love broccoli and cauliflower. I will be using this recipe soon. The reviews were very helpful.
Great simple recipe. I took it to a potluck. I used pre-packaged real bacon bits and it still tasted great. This would be good with lettuce in the bottom too!

Loved it! I used a ton of veggies (entire head of cauliflower and almost as much broccoli). I made a double batch of the sauce, but didn't use it all. My husband thought there was too much sauce, but I thought it was great. Thanks for the recipe!

Great recipe but must be modified. I doubled or tripled the amount of broccoli and cauliflower. Added 4 eggs, 12 slices bacon, and only added 1/3c sugar, left out the cheese only because of a lactose intolerant person. Everything else was the same. I stired everything together, instead of putting the dressing on top. Made it for fathers day and it was gone. Will absolutly make it again with the modifications.

I made this only slightly different to recipe due to other people's recommendations. I used whole cauliflower head, 3 brocolli bunches-cut both into bite size pieces. Made for two functions so I halved each evenly and placed into 2 separate bowls. I omited egg. I used pre-cooked bacon (to save on time), using 6 slices for each bowl of broc/caul blend. Also added 1 cup shredded cheddar to each bowl, and 1/4 cup red onion to each bowl. (i placed cheese, bacon, and mayo blend in just before serving). Mayo blend--I used 1 cup mayo, 1 tbsp white vinegar, and 1 teaspoon lemon juice (didn't have white wine vinegar). I then divided the amount equally and added each half into each bowl. Just enough to coat and give flavor, but not enough to make it too mayonaisy, if that makes sense. 1st group left no leftovers and mentioned they didn't think they'd like but did. Other group not as many tried but those that did, liked it. I really liked it and that's why I'm giving 5 stars. Thanks for the recipe. I was looking for something different and will be making this in future when I have two functions to attend. One prep time, two functions--couldn't be any better!

My hubby, who is not a fan of broccoli or cauliflower, loved this salad. The only changes I made was to use Splenda instead of sugar, and real bacon bits instead of bacon...just to save some time and mess. Very yummy, a definite keeper!

I have always liked Broccoli-Cauliflower salad when I attended fellowship meals and such, but I never took the time to find a recipe. A few weeks ago I decided to look and I found this one. It is delicious. My family loves it and it is so easy to make. I substituted lemon juice for the vinegar because I had no way of getting any white wine vinegar in our small rural town. I also prefer to mix everything together instead of layering it. And this second time around I doubled the veges, cheese and bacon but left the amounts of dressing ingredients the same. The recipe was much better with less dressing (and I had wasted some last time). I also leave out the optional eggs. Mainly because I have never ever had a broccoli-cauliflower salad with eggs and it didn't sound appetizing. I still give this 5 stars though.
This is one of my all-time FAVORITE foods! It is sooo good.
Delicious and so easy to make! Everyone really liked the dressing on it as well.

Nice refreshing salad. I used a generous cup of broccoli and Cauliflower, cut the dressing in half, using only a scant 1/4 C sugar and added 1/4 C sunflower seeds. 4 eggs as about 2 cups, and I mixed the dressing with the veggies before putting the rest on top of the cheese. Ended up adding some raisins after tasting. Could easily have used some more B&C with this amount of dressing. Family liked it, will make again.

Yum... looked pretty and taste terrific even though I had subbed peas for the broccoli because it's what I had on hand; I also added a dash of worcershire sauce to the mayo and a few T of parmesan cheese then spread it over the cauliflower layer before the cheese and bacon for presentaton and since only the vegetables needed dressing.. Thanks for this recipe! :)
Double the veggies, don't use the egg, bacon bits work great, use ultra fine sugar if making last minute

Nice recipe. I used 2 heads of cauliflower and 2 bunches of broccoli, instead of cooking bacon, I used a package of REAL bacon bits, and topped with sunflower seeds. I also added some chopped green onions. Put all of this in a 13x9 baking dish. The only complaint I recieved was that there was not enough dressing.
Love this recipe. The flavors are amazing. Great for party or potluck

This is a five star winner. I changed the sugar to granulated splenda, the mayo to low-fat and only used 3/4 as much mayo. Also added a mixture of red/green onion as a layer, chopped celery, as well as sunflower seed kernels. I made this for church potlucks as well as family gatherings. For this reason, I serve the dressing on the side to accommodate all preferences. INCREDIBLY GOOD!
I make this recipe all the time, except i use brown sugar and cider vingear, no eggs, and a lot more cheese and bacon. For those who dont like it to sweet the cider vingear works great

My mom made this at Christmas dinner as a last ditch effort to get us to eat vegetables because nobody ever eats any vegetables with all the other good food around. We gobbled it up! It was wonderful. She did leave the boiled eggs out because she didn't think it sounded good. I am adding this to my recipe box and will be making it often.

I made this salad for a family get together for the Holidays, and it didn't last long.. They loved it so much they all asked to the recipe. A change from the regular salads we use to have. I just didn't use that much sugar. About 3 tablespoons is all I used. It was a winner in my book. Will fix this one from now on..
A hit at dinner! Everyone loved it :-) My husband thinks I should make it more often. A refreshing salad with lots of crunch. I used plain vinegar, and added 1 tablespoon of lemon juice.
